frame.name: Performers
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their participation in artistic performances.
The <fen>Person</fen> is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships. They may have a <fen>Descriptor</fen>, <fen>Origin</fen>, <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen>, or <fen>Ethnicity</fen>. A specific <fen>Age</fen> may sometimes be specified as well.</def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Origin</fen> is the place where the <fen>Person</fen> was born or lived a salient part of her or his life.
<ex>Sir Alec Guiness was a <fex name="Ori">British</fex> <t>actor</t> until his death.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Person
FE.definition:
The Person is the human being. Smithers is a brilliant actor.

(Note that the Person FE is incorporated in the LU actor.n.)

FE.name: Persistent_characteristic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen> is a physiological characteristic or personality trait of the <fen>Person</fen> which is conceived of as persisting over time.
<ex>Billy Throb is a <fex name="psc">swarthy</fex> <t>actor</t> who frequently plays in scary movies.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Descriptor</fen> is a temporary condition of the <fen>Person</fen>.
<ex>Hundreds of <fex name="desc">angry</fex> <t>actors</t> were protesting against the new contract</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Age
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Age</fen> is the length of time the <fen>Person</fen> has been alive.
<ex>I need help with the name of an <fex name="age">old</fex> <t>actor</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ethnicity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Ethnicity</fen> is the religious, racial, national, socio-economic or cultural group to which the <fen>Person</fen> belongs.
<ex>She's one of the most famous <fex name="eth">black</fex> <t>actresses</t> around today</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context_of_acquaintance
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression indicating the context with which the <fen>Person</fen> is associated.
<ex>Is she the <t>actress</t> <fex name="coa">from the movie we saw last night</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Rank</fen> is the position in a hierarchy that a <fen>Person</fen> occupies within a performance.
<ex>Robin is the <fex name="rnk">lead</fex> <t>actress</t> in La Notte.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place_of_employment
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the Place where the <fen>Person</fen> works.
<ex><t>Actors</t> <fex name="poe">at the Theater on the Square</fex> went on strike</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Employer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Employer</fen> gives compensation to an <fen>Person</fen> for their work.
<ex>Margaret's fortunes improved in 1949 when she joined a host of young <fex name="emp">MGM</fex> <t>actresses</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Type</fen> of performer the <fen>Person</fen> is.
<ex>Smithers is a <fex name="typ">stage</fex> <t>actor</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Compensation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Compensation</fen> is the payment that the <fen>Person</fen> receives for performing a task.
<ex>Barney Smith is a <fex name="com">highly-paid</fex> <t>actor</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Contract_basis
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Contract_basis</fen> describes the conditions of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period, or payment basis.
<ex>Smithers is a <fex name="cb">part-time</fex> <t>actor</t> at the National Theater </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: actress.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a woman who performs a role in a theatrical performance

lexUnit.name: actor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who performs a role in a theatrical performance

lexUnit.name: musician.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who plays music in a concert
